intro: Oreocarya eulophus, commonly known as the Sierra violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, low-growing stems and showy violet flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, while its flowers bloom in shades of purple or violet. Oreocarya eulophus is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes.
